metadata.title: CVE-2022-42898 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
PAC parsing in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.19.4 and 1.20.x before1.20.1 has integer overflows that may lead to remote code execution (inKDC, kadmind, or a GSS or Kerberos application server) on 32-bit platforms(which have a resultant heap-based buffer overflow), and cause a denial ofservice on other platforms. This occurs in krb5_pac_parse inlib/krb5/krb/pac.c. Heimdal before 7.7.1 has "a similar bug."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42898` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.20.1-1build1
krb5-gss-samples - 1.20.1-1build1
krb5-k5tls - 1.20.1-1build1
krb5-kdc - 1.20.1-1build1
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.20.1-1build1
krb5-kpropd - 1.20.1-1build1
krb5-locales - 1.20.1-1build1
krb5-multidev - 1.20.1-1build1
krb5-otp - 1.20.1-1build1
krb5-pkinit - 1.20.1-1build1
krb5-user - 1.20.1-1build1
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.20.1-1build1
libgssrpc4 - 1.20.1-1build1
libk5crypto3 - 1.20.1-1build1
libkadm5clnt-mit12 - 1.20.1-1build1
libkadm5srv-mit12 - 1.20.1-1build1
libkdb5-10 - 1.20.1-1build1
libkrad0 - 1.20.1-1build1
libkrb5-3 - 1.20.1-1build1
libkrb5support0 - 1.20.1-1build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: heimdal package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
krb5 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.20.1-1build1').
samba package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.17.3+dfsg-3ubuntu1').
